lexUnit.name: indulgent.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: readily indulging someone or overlooking their faults; tolerant or lenient.

sentence.text: Serve warm with Greek yogurt or , if you 're feeling self indulgent , double cream .
Similarly farmers are more prepared to be indulgent about their employees ' working hours as long as the necessary tasks are carried out efficiently .
He wrote that it was “ not cruel to animals but , rather , indulgent to men … since it absolves them of the suspicion of crime when they eat or kill animals ” .

He thought , but did not say , that murder provided its own dreadful excitement for those who neither mourned nor were directly concerned and that people were commonly indulgent to those who helped provide the entertainment .
Courts , in short , are especially kind and indulgent to women .
Pope John was not weak , was not a compromiser , was not indulgent towards erroneous opinions or towards the so-called inevitability of history etc .
They will be feeling indulgent towards us , because we are not so evidently , so rowdily in love ; yet we should be discreetly indulgent towards them .
They will be feeling indulgent towards us , because we are not so evidently , so rowdily in love ; yet we should be discreetly indulgent towards them .
Serge was no longer as indulgent with her .
She was usually so indulgent with him .
Towards the end of the play 's run , he got more indulgent with Pearson .
Sartori had been indulgent for the weeks they 'd been together .

The Examiner 's Report for 1890 stated : " The work and discipline in the School seem to improve term by term -- yet there Is room for greater improvement if some parents would be a little less indulgent in giving excuses for their boys for not having prepared their work . "
LEOPOLD AND WOLFGANG had arrived home after their second Italian trip to a death -- that of Leopold 's kindly and indulgent employer , Count Schrattenbach , Archbishop of Salzburg .
Instead , as we walked down to the bar this evening , he had been all smiles and indulgent gallantry , complimenting us on our appearance , an arm lightly circling each of our waists .
Even the most indulgent husband would find it hard to forgive this foolish wife .
He roared with laughter , shaking his head for all the world as if Caterina were some naughty imp and he an indulgent uncle .
I do n't believe you have to be all that indulgent .
Father Duryea appeared to be hopeful and indulgent .
` Barbs would n't care , " said Sam , and Camille had to concede that Barbs was stunningly indulgent .
Normally he could go for weeks without being so indulgent ; but the MacQuillan case had brought Rain Morgan back into his life and with her some poignant memories .
Unmarried girls observe such vratas mainly to obtain a prosperous and loving husband , an indulgent and caring marital family , and to die before their husbands .
Mothers tend to be less indulgent and more demanding with daughters at this age than with sons , and fathers to be similarly favourably inclined towards their daughters .
You 're right to be sceptical : we should be indulgent only to a certain point with lovers , whose vanities rival those of politicians .
